alert.note: Alert for Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 7:37PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montezuma and southwestern La Plata Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 736 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Mancos, or 23 miles west of Durango, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mancos. This includes U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 48 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
